content:
What is the most common term used in genetics to describe the
observable physical characteristics of an organism caused by the expression of a gene or set of
genes?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What is the biological term most often used for the act of a cell
engulfing a particle by extending its pseudopodia (read as: SU-doe-POH-dee-ah) around the
particle?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
An aqueous solution in which the concentration of OH– ions is
greater than that of H+ ions is:
W) basic
X) acidic
Y) neutral
Z) in equilibrium
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Find the mass of 1 mole of cuprous oxide, or Cu O. Assume the
2
atomic mass of copper is 64 and oxygen is 16.
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What property of a sound wave is most commonly associated with
loudness?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
What is the MOST common term for the behavior of light where it
appears to bend around small obstacles or the spreading out of waves as light passes through
pinholes or slits?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
What term BEST describes 2 angles with 90º as the sum of their
measurements?
subject: MATH

content:
Divide the following and give your answer in scientific notation:
8×107
1
(4×104)2
subject: MATH

content:
The overall charge at the top and bottom, respectively, of a
towering cumulonimbus cloud during a thunderstorm is:
W) positive, positive
X) positive, negative
Y) negative, positive
Z) negative, negative
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
A lightning bolt is seen and its accompanying thunder is
heard 15 seconds later. This means the storm is most likely how many miles away:
W) 3
X) 6
Y) 9
Z) 15
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content: How many significant figures are in the number 0.00750?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Subtract the following 2 numbers and give your answer
with the proper significant figures: 25.101 – 0.9608
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
What is the proper name of the star that is most commonly noted
to have coordinates closest to the north celestial pole?
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: NORTH STAR (ACCEPT: POLARIS or ALPHA URSA MINORIS)

content: What is the most well-known asterism in Ursa Major?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Human epidermis is mostly composed of which of the following
basic animal tissues types:
W) epithelial
X) connective
Y) nervous
Z) muscle
subject: BIOLOGY

content: What are the 2 basic categories of lymphocyte cells?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: T AND B (ACCEPT: B AND T CELLS)High School Round 1 Page 4

content:
What general type of bonding is found in molecules in which
electrons are shared by nuclei?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Name all of the following 4 processes where latent heat is
absorbed: evaporation; condensation; water melts; water freezes
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Although not known as such at the time, what was the first form of
spectacular electric discharge seen by humans?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
A constant force acting on a body experiencing no change in its
environment will give the body:
W) constant acceleration
X) constant speed
Y) constant velocity
Z) zero acceleration
subject: PHYSICS
answer: W) CONSTANT ACCELERATIONHigh School Round 1 Page 5

content:
Giving your answer in inches and in simplest radical form, if the
hypotenuse of a 45-45-90º triangle is 10 inches, find the length of the other sides:
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following is a sedimentary rock:
W) slate
X) marble
Y) basalt
Z) sandstone
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is LEAST accurate about
minerals:
W) calcite has a hardness of 3 on most of its surfaces but a hardness of 4 along the crystal face
perpendicular to its long axis
X) the Moh’s scale measures the absolute hardness of minerals
Y) a mineral’s chemical composition largely determines its crystal shape and cleavage pattern
Z) a mineral’s color is the same as its streak
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Z) A MINERAL’S COLOR IS THE SAME AS ITS STREAKHigh School Round 1 Page 6

content:
Which of the following is closest to the meaning of the
suffix ‘lith’:
W) outside
X) stone
Y) side
Z) surface
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Rounded to the nearest whole number, how many feet
does light travel in one-billionth of one second?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content: What star has the greatest apparent magnitude?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content: What planet is known to be most like Earth in size and density?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content: How many embryonic seed leaves does a bean seedling have?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 5 plants that are dicots:
wheat; geranium; garlic; bamboo; rose
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is a metallic element, composes about
5% of the Earth’s crust, oxidizes very easily, and when pure is a dark, silver-grey metal:
W) cobalt
X) nickel
Y) iron
Z) titanium
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
In general, metals are relatively hard except for what group of
metals in the Periodic Table?
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: ONE (ACCEPT: GROUP 1A or ALKALI METALS)High School Round 1 Page 8

content:
Upon which of the following does the mass of a body MOST
directly depend:
W) its magnetic properties
X) how much volume it has
Y) the amount of matter it contains
Z) its location
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Y) THE AMOUNT OF MATTER IT CONTAINS

content:
Mary and Joe are on a merry-go-round. Mary is seated near the
center of rotation and Joe is on the outer edge. Which of the following BEST describes their motion:
W) Mary has a greater acceleration than Joe
X) Joe has a greater acceleration than Mary
Y) neither Mary nor Joe are accelerating
Z) both Mary and Joe have the same acceleration
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) JOE HAS A GREATER ACCELERATION THAN MARY

content:
Giving your answer in terms of π and in inches, what is the arc-length of
a semi-circle whose diameter is 18 inches?
subject: MATH

content:
What is the area, in square feet, of a triangle whose perpendicular height
is 20 feet with a base of 12 feet?
subject: MATH
answer: 120(Solution: A = ½ bh = ½ (12)(20) = 120 ft2)High School Round 1 Page 9

content:
Which of the following terms best describes the albedo of
a planet:
W) electromagnetic energy
X) density
Y) reflectivity
Z) absorption
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of what occurs during
an equinox:
W) equal length of day and night except at the poles
X) the Earth is not tilted with respect to the ecliptic
Y) the Sun is directly overhead at the equator
Z) the Moon is directly overhead at the poles
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Z) THE MOON IS DIRECTLY OVERHEAD AT THE POLES

content:
What gas is most directly responsible for the bends or
decompression sickness that divers may experience?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
In degrees Celsius to the nearest whole number, what is
the normal core body temperature of a human being?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content: What is the declination of the north celestial pole?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content: The Sagittarius Arm is part of what galaxy?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
If a plant had a taproot, it would also most likely have:
W) parallel leaf venation
X) two cotyledons in its seedling stage
Y) diffusely arranged vascular bundles in its stem
Z) no stomata on the upper surfaces of its leaves
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: X) TWO COTYLEDONS IN ITS SEEDLING STAGE

content:
Using the traditional system of classification, when organisms
belong to the same class, name all of the following 4 taxonomic categories to which they must also
belong: order; family; phylum; kingdom
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
According to standard chemical nomenclature and indicating the
proper charge, what is the formula for hydrogen sulfide?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Of the following group of 4 cations, which are the LARGEST
and SMALLEST ions, respectively: K+; Na+; Rb+; Li+
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: LARGEST = Rb+; SMALLEST = Li+ (ACCEPT: RUBIDIUM AND LITHIUM)

content:
Martin is swinging a yo-yo in a large room with a circular motion
perpendicular to a level floor. If the yo-yo breaks away from its string at the top of the yo-yo’s
circular path, in what direction will the yo-yo initially move:
W) at an angle between horizontal and vertical
X) straight up, toward the ceiling
Y) straight down, to the floor
Z) horizontally, tangent to its original circular path
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Z) HORIZONTALLY, TANGENT TO ITS ORIGINAL CIRCULAR PATH

content:
What is the BEST term for the tendency of any mass at rest to remain
at rest?
subject: PHYSICS

content: What is the genus name of the most thoroughly studied bacterium?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 3 processes that do NOT occur in E. coli:
glycolysis; photosynthesis; glycogenolysis (read as: GLYKO-jen-oh-LY-sis)
subject: BIOLOGY
